svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 62, exploded view of countershaft assembly and reverse idler gear.

figure.caption: Figure 62. Exploded View of Countershaft Assembly & Reverse Idler Gear

svcproc.para: Prior to reassembling the mainshaft, check the unit for signs of wear or damage. As the unit is disassembled, check each part. Replace any component that shows signs of wear or damage, .
Synchronizers:Both internal and external teeth must have sharp edges. Rounded corners or excessive chipping will cause gear jumping. Also examine the synchronizer rings for metal contamination.
Gears:Examine for broken or cracked operating teeth or clutching teeth. Also check for any unusual wear patterns. If a gear must be replaced, also remember to replace its mating gear.
Thrust Washers:Check for flatness, excessive face wear, cracks, scoring, or signs of heat damage.
Snap Rings:Examine for distortion or loss of tension. New snap rings are recommended with every rebuild.
Mainshaft:Check splines for sharp corners. Worn or ironed out gear locks will produce gear jumping. Also check for chipped spline at snap ring grooves.

Replacement Parts:Exploded views of sub-assemblies are incorporated into this service manual for the mechanic's convenience. Parts are arranged in their correct order. The drawings may be used as a reference for assembly or disassembly of this unit.
